Don't believe the hype. This game is mediocre at best, definitely not the gaming milestone it's made out to be. Mechanically dumbed down, generic FPS gameplay meets poorly-thought out plotting and condescending political commentary.
Single parts of the mechanics or plot in particular can feel especially insulting, depending on your personal disposition.

[u]The Good[/u]

It's legitimately pretty, mostly thanks to a very strong artstyle.
Generally very high production values, including top-tier voice work.
The story/plotlines start out very strong and interesting.
The exploration part of the gameplay is legitimately fun and feels like a well-designed first person adventure of sorts.

[u]The Bad:[/u]

The whole shooting gameplay in general is just not fun. Gunplay is generally underwhelming, with many of the guns feeling samey, especially after you unlock a second line of guns from another faction that basically just iterates with slight variances on guns you already have. You *can* upgrade guns by spending money at specific upgrade machines, but the upgrades only add generic +damage/rate of fire/ammo percentages. 
Since you can only carry 2 guns at a a time and there are distinct sections of the game where using specific guns lends definitive advantages, you'd either have to know in advance which guns to carry into which battle and upgrade accordingly, or upgrade either no guns at all or all guns in a balanced fashion to keep them all viable in case you need to swap. The whole system is just poorly-thought out in general.
Enemies have little to no variety and at times remarkably poor AI, and large scale battles devolve into frantic, chaotic messes with no strategic approach to speak of. 
Even coming from a series known for generally underwhelming gunplay (BS2 being the exception), this game is easily the worst in the series in terms of combat and shooting mechanics.
Vigors (Plasmids) all feel very samey (no distinction between attack, control and support plasmids like in BS1 and 2, instead each vigor fulfills all these functions simultaneously to varying degrees) and only really vary in visual representation, with Undertow being the only notable exception. You can also upgrade vigors by paying money at specific upgrade stations, but that cuts into your funds for upgrading guns. There are no unique upgrade mechanics for either. (Personal pet peeve: I also think that a lot of the visual changes on the player avatar's hands when using certain vigors venture too far into body horror territory and are just too gross, resulting in a thematic disconnect between narrative and onscreen action.)
Terrible "inventory"/gear system. You can't carry med-packs or "Salts" (this setting's version of EVE) with you any more to peruse as necessary, only refill your current health/salts from stationary deposits. You get a rechargeable shield to "make up" for it, but it just generally results in more messiness during actual combat.
No stealth at all.
No Big Daddies; the "Handymen" of this setting are supposedly designed as a substitute, but they don't fulfill that role adequately, neither thematically nor mechanically.
As a long-time "Shock" fan (starting out with the System Shock series), the oversimplification of game mechanics to the point of dumbing it down to a generic dudebro fps (aka "streamlining" as it's known in the industry) is just... disappointing.

[u]The Ugly (contains spoilers):[/u]

Remember what I said about the plotlines starting out very strong and interesting?
Yeah, about the only plotline here coming to any sort of closure is the one about the relationship between Elizabeth and Songbird.
The main plot just fizzles out into a disappointing mess. (Booker is/becomes Comstock, because of differing timelines and ONE singular defining event in his life, because apparently that's how people and psychology work. Also, Elizabeth *basically* becomes a Timelord, because Quantum Mechanics.)
There is also an obvious thematic disconnect between portraying Booker's violent past (with him rather obviously having suffered from PTSD, survivor's guilt, depression and generally self-destructive behaviour before the events of the game) as having a detrimental effect on him,so much so that he has obvious violent tendencies (with you being given the choice of indulging in these tendencies at certain points of the game) in everyday interactions and even small-scale interpersonal conflict (comparable to Joel from "The Last of Us") and is generally what we would call "not a nice person", with a clear indication that this is NOT a good thing. Yet here the game is, absolutely reveling in its own cartoonishly grotesque depiction of graphic violence. A more toned-down, realistic approach might have worked wonders here. (cf. my point about the Vigors and body horror.)

And the resolution to the sideplot about Fitzroy and the Vox Populi is intellectually insulting at best and rage-inducing at worst. 
The game is just straight up saying that the downtrodden, oppressed masses of workers consisting solely of People of Color and the Irish, who rise up against their rich, white, racist, industrialist oppressors in a necessarily violent revolt are just total extreme extremists and therefore JUST AS BAD if not even WORSE than the racist people keeping them oppressed.
After a specific point in the story that completely derails the character of one of your allies, the revolutionary faction (called the Vox Populi) just become generic, evil, mass-murdering mooks and your second set of standard enemies. 
What the FUCK, Ken Levine? How about you take your uninformed, patronizing "Extremism is bad, m'kay?" moderatism and shove it up your fucking arse, you pretentious fuckwad?

Oh, and before I forget it: THE "EPIC END FIGHT" IS A FIRST PERSON TOWER DEFENSE MISSION. FUCK THIS GAME.

Die Bioshock-Serie ist neben Half-Life mein Lieblings-Franchise in Sachen FPS - und Infinite mein Favorit aus der Serie. Der dritte Teil geschaffen aus der Feder vom Entwicklerteam Irrational Games, die für ihre innovativen Genre-Mixes berühmt sind, haben einen perfekten Ritt vollgepackt mit explosiven Szenen, abwechslungsreichen Shootouts und einer interessanten "Was-wäre-wenn"-Story, in einer der mit Abstand coolsten Spielewelten überhaupt, erschaffen.

Anders als der erste Bioshock-Teil ist Infinite ein recht moderner Shooter mit linearer Erzählstruktur. Der Spieler wird an einem roten Faden durch die Story - gefüllt mit gut getimten Plottwists - geführt und immer wieder in intensive Kämpfe verwickelt. Zurück sind die Plasmiden, die jedem Feuergefecht die nötige Würze verleihen und einmal mehr kreative Möglichkeiten geben, sich der Feinde zu entledigen. 

Auch geheime Räume, Audiographen und Verbesserungen gibt es jede Menge zu finden. Super auch, dass man die Hintergrundinfos einfach nebenbei als Hörbuch laufen lassen kann, anstatt dass das Spiel unterbrochen wird. So verliert Infinite über die gesamte Dauer nie an Fahrt!

Was Bioshock: Infinite jedoch so besonders macht, ist das World Building und die beiden Hauptcharaktere. Ähnlich wie beim ersten Teil findet man sich zügig in einem Utopia wieder - diesmal eine schwebende Stadt - die eine grässliche Grimasse hinter der Fassade versteckt. Anders als bei Teil 1 fällt die Maske jedoch erst im Spielverlauf. Während Repture bereits zerstört ist und man im Nachhinein erfährt, was geschah, entwickelt sich hier der Zerfall vor den Augen des Spielers. 

Überragend gelungen ist Elizabeth, die zweite Hauptfigur. Sie ist eine mehr oder minder stetige Begleiterin des Spielers, die niemals im Weg steht und bei Gelegenheit Booker mit Items oder Münzen versorgt. Mehr als das, jedoch, überzeugt die Art, wie sie die Welt reflektiert. Selten - wenn überhaupt - hat es ein Spiel geschafft, einen Charakter so menschlich wirken zu lassen. Besonders gelungen sind die Züge ihres Gesichts, denen man jede Emotion ablesen kann. Man kann sich nicht dagegen wehren, mit Elizabeth mitzufühlen. Sie sorgt für eine irre Immersion in die Story und die Welt. Sensationell gut gelungen!

Was gibt es negatives über dieses Spiel zu sagen? Es ist ein bisschen Schade, dass man immer nur zwei Waffen bei sich tragen darf. 

Ansonsten ist Bioshock: Infinite ein absolutes Meisterstück der Spielegeschichte, welches eine tiefgründige Story mit exzellentem Gameplay und nahezu perfektem Pacing verbindet. Ein unvergesslicher Trip, den man definitiv mehr als einmal unternehmen wird. 

Ebenfalls zu empfehlen ist auch ausnahmsweisemal der Season Pass mit seinen beiden Episoden Burial at Sea - 1&2, die die Story zurück nach Rapture bringen. 

Neben Half-Life 2 möglicherweise mein favorisierter Ego-Shooter...zumindest unter denen, die eine Story erzählen

Oyun gerçekten mükemmeldi oynanış olsun, grafikler olsun, atmosfer olsun hepsi çok iyidi.Infiniteyi anlamak için diyer oyunları da bitirmek zorunda değilsiniz. Oyun hakkında birkaç tavsiye vereyim.Bolca gezin oyunda 'N' tuşuna basarsanız eğer oyun size nereye gitmeniz gerektiğini gösteriyor , işte bu gösterdiği yerlerin hep zıt yönlerine gidin oralarda gear,salt,medic ve güzel silahlar bulmanız olası ayrıca yüklü miktarda silver eagle da bulabilirsiniz. Gearlarınızı nasıl oynamayı seviyorsanız öyle dizin ve bulabildiğiniz kadar gear bulmaya bakın. Sağlık,Kalkan ve tuz kapasitesini arttıran şeyler mevcut bunlardan ne kadar çok bulursanız o kadar iyi. Size önerim önce sağlığa sonra kalkana basmanız. Oyunda kullanmayı en çok sevdiğim silah  shotgun ve carbine iksi de gerçekten işe yarar silahlar rpg ve sniper kullanmanızı önermem bir zamandan sonra düşman sayısı çok fazla oluyor ve sniperla hepsini tek tek vurmaya çalışmak saçmalık olur :D
Hazır indirimdeyken almanızı tavsiye ederim. İyi oyunlar

真的不亏！
真的不亏！
虽然只有短短六个小时的游戏时间，但已经能够体会到游戏的精彩程度，传统fps加上特殊技能的使用使得战斗系统并不十分精彩，但此代对比前两代而言难度相对还是有所降低，这对于我这种一代二代一路无限死过来的玩家来说已经十分友好了。
游戏的剧情十分出彩，女主角伊丽莎白的美丽与迷人就不多加赘述了，评论区的其他玩家已经概括的差不多了，可爱，动人，人物的塑造十分立体（伊丽莎白是我的各位拔剑吧）。
游戏剧情十分优秀，个人剧情进行到四分之一，、对我来说印象最深的还是第一小部分寻找伊丽莎白，这小段剧情给我很大震撼，特别是从不同的窗口去观察伊丽莎白如戏剧一般的表现，十分期待接下来的剧情发展。
最后，真的建议对这款游戏有兴趣的玩家入手，珍藏版真的很值，真的很值！！！！

This Stand Alone Bioshock game is so sick!. It's more like a heavy story game than other conventional FPS games. The story is unforgettable (it's stuck in my head for a day after I finish it), it was so good the plot is not dragging and when I reach near the ending of the story it makes me blown away. The gameplay mechanics are so cool you can use some skill to trick your enemy, got so many types of weapon, and "skyhook" is so cool. I recommend you play this one. Final Score 5/5.

I finally got the chance to play Bioshock Infinite, grabbing it during steam summer sale, i played the entire game in almost 1 sitting. The story had me hooked. I needed to know what was going to happen, how was this story going to continue. What obsticles will come my way? What will have to be done to overcome them?

As someone who likes to explore and opening almost every box i can, upgrading and seeing what works best, Bioshock Infinite made me thirsy for the story. The combat within the game was entertaining albeit repetative. Messing around with the powers and seeing what i enjoyed the most/ what combo's could clear squads of enemies was probably the most fun. The combat was not the highlight of this game. Not at all. The story, how it drags you into it. How quickly you start to care for the characters you meet and learn their stories through the recordings you find throughout the game. You'll have yourself half sprinting through the motions to find out what happens next but stopping yourself to look around at the gorgeous game that you are in.

TL;DR: This game is beautiful, atmospheric and will have you strapped into the game for the story. The combat can be repetative but not drawn out too much in my opinion.

Though many will most likely disagree, I believe BioShock Infinite to be the strongest BioShock yet, story wise that is. It is probably the worst Bioshock gameplay wise, however it is still infinitely more fun than many other typical first-person shooters (cod, battlefield, etc.). The lack of a weapon wheel is one of the most disapointing things for me, without a weapon wheel like we had in the first 2 games, you're limited to whatever 2 guns you currently have on you and whatever guns just happen to be laying around. But the sky-hooks helped Ininite's gameplay to have something new and unique that neither of the past BioShocks had. The story of this BioShock seemed to be the main focus, it was just amazing. Not to mention the ending was a HUGE twist and kept me thinking about this game days, weeks, and even months after finishing it. This game is truely a must play.
This game is absolutely beautiful, the graphic and the storyline are great combination but the ending from this game is not really impressed me.

10.3 hours (What I have on record as of 7/2/17) is the length of the campaign. Here is my ratings

Story: 10
Gameplay: 9
Atmosphere: 10
Scenery: 10
Characters: 10

Overall Score: 49/50= 98%

Personal Note: Bioshock infinite is the first game that I have played from the Bioshock series. I knew absolutley nothing about the bioshock series, so this is one of those games that I just jumped into and hoped for the best. To my fortune, it was more than good, it was great. I thought the campaign would be longer, considering that people have 14-25 hours of gameplay. Since there was alot to see in bioshock infinite, I took my time to look at everything and made sure I never missed a spot, but I still ended up with only 10.3 hours. Despite that, I encourage you if you are reading this, to just take the chance and jump into the game like I did.

If there was anything I would have wished for in the game, it would be one more gun slot instead of 2.

Edit: After playing through a second time, this time treating it like how I play COD campaigns (Listening in on the story, just looking for enemies, and not really exploring). The campaign lasted about 7.2 hours for me.

Eu queria fazer um textinho T O P aqui, para descrever meu amor por esse jogo, mas, não há palavras suficientes para isso. Trilha sonora do CACETE! História... PUTZ, nem se fala, a história é do CARALHO! E se você gosta de uma história que é muuuito boa, da uma bugada mental, e depois que você zera, você fica tipo, "OQ?! COMO ASSIM CARALHO, PUTA Q PARIU, QUAL O SENTIDO DA PORRA E MISERÁVEL VIDA, PUTA MERDA, EU TÔ EXPLODINDO, ALGUÉM ME AJUDA! AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA" ESSE JOGO, É PRA VOCÊ! COMMMPRRAAAAAAAAAAAAA LOOOOOOOOOOOOOOGO!
Compra isso, sério. COMPRA LOGO!

One of the best games I've ever played. Can't really describe it, you need to play it to feel it.

Trama eccezionale e ambientazione che toglie il respiro. Non ci sono parole per descriverlo. Un'esperienza che tutti gli amanti della saga e qualsiasi persona a cui piacciono questo tipo di giochi dovrebbero giocare

I just beat Burial at Sea with my friend and I honestly have never played any other game franchise that will top how I felt throughout this series

-The art style and the atmosphere, from Rapture to Columbia, was by far the most beautiful I've ever seen and felt in a game

-The characters and plot, both from Burial at Sea and the base game kept me hooked for the entirety of the game

-Burial at Sea bridged the gap between Bioshock One with Infinite in the most spectacular way possible

-And lastly, Burial at Sea wonderfully explained things we've asked ourselves when playing the original Bioshock, like why do the Big Daddies bond so well with their Little Sisters

So far, no other game series has topped how much I've enjoyed the franchise and I honestly think there won't be any.

I highly recommend this game series to anyone who's looking for an amazing story-driven experience
建议大家把DLC一起入了，连着生化奇兵1和2，你将会看到一个完整的故事。3里面的男女主是我最喜欢的，希望他们能在我们玩家看不到的地方，开始他们的“新”生活，平凡幸福地度过一生。在埃菲尔铁塔下，看似陌生又熟悉的女子对着不远处的男人挥着她的手……
It's the best game ever.
